issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: Fix FairScheduler's REST api returns a missing '[' blacket JSON for childQueues.

fields.summary: Web services returns incorrect JSON for deep queue tree

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Document the Fair Scheduler REST API

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
When we have sub queues in Fair Scheduler, REST api returns a missing '[' blacket JSON for childQueues.
This issue found by [~ajisakaa] at YARN-1050.
fields.summary: Fair scheduler REST api returns a missing '[' bracket JSON for deep queue tree

comments.body:
Attached a patch.
To notice childQueues as a collection to JSONJAXBContext, this patch introduces FairSchedulerQueueInfoList.
I refered to MAPREDUCE-4020.

This message was automatically generated.
Taking a look at the patch shortly.

Thanks [~ozawa] for reviewing the patch.
bq. We have an option to return empty hash, {}, or array, []. Currently, "users", another collection field which can be returned in RM's RESTful API, returns null. In the context, the behaviour of your patch looks consistent to me. 
Returning {} is a good choice, however, consistency is more important for me. Users may confuse if FairScheduler's REST API is different from other REST APIs.

I failed the markup :-P
{code}
childQueues(array)
 |---- childQueues(array)
          |---- childQueues(array)
 |---- childQueues(array)
{code}
I see. Should we remove childQueue when childQueue is null for the consistency? CapacityScheduler doesn't return childQueues if queue is null(empty).

bq. Should we remove childQueue when childQueue is null for the consistency? 
Agree. I'll remove it from FairSchedulerLeafQueueInfo.
I'd like to review it. Please ping me after fixing the issue.

v7 patch:
* Removed "childQueues" from output in FairSchedulerLeafQueueInfo.
* Updated document for JSON and XML.
